reviewText: I love all of the DVD's I ordered thanx
The truth about this drug and the effects on individuals. Very hard to think of your child going threw this problem.

I purchased this film with the intent to show it to a group of nursing students to help understand a bit more about meth. The film focuses on biographies and less about teaching. The content will still be helpful, but not what an educator would look for.

Great for drug education.  Kids are very interested in it, however; I think it would be better for an adult rehab than in a teen life skills class.  Adult stories, kids have a little difficulty in relating to, however they are interested in the subject matter.

It's mainly interviews of the actual people arrested for meth manufacturing. It shows pictures of the faces as they age while doing the drug. They lose teeth and have sores on their face from peeling their skin due to a itchy sensation. They show graphic photos of the burns from meth lab explosions as well as real life accounts of people who tell their story from going from a normal productive individual of society to a bottom of the barrel drug user. If you are thinking of trying meth or have a friend who wants to try it or just started, this documentary is for you or them. It is the same ending for all users:Jail or Death.
a wonderful teaching tool for our substance abuse program. It is hard to find good videos that show the impact of substance abuse and the damage that it does to families and society.
